com.nttdocomo.io
Class ConnectionException

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.lang.Throwable
        |
        +--java.lang.Exception
              |
              +--java.io.IOException
                    |
                    +--com.nttdocomo.io.ConnectionException
public class ConnectionException
extends java.io.IOException

This class defines communication exceptions and is used to indicate that exceptions have been generated in input and output processing with com.nttdocomo.io and com.nttdocomo.net. Details on exceptions can be obtained via the getStatus method.

Field Detail

UNDEFINED

public static final int UNDEFINED
Means exceptions that have not been defined (=0).
This is generated when an exception of which status has not been defined within this class has occurred.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

STATUS_FIRST

public static final int STATUS_FIRST
The first value of exceptions defined by the system.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

STATUS_LAST

public static final int STATUS_LAST
The last value of exceptions defined by the system.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ILLEGAL_STATE

public static final int ILLEGAL_STATE
Means that the status of the object is illegal (=1) .
This is generated in an http connection, when the openInputStream, the openOutputStream or the connect method of the Connector class is called for an object in a state in which these methods should not be called. This is generated in a scratchpad connection, when the openOutputStream or the openDataOutputStream method of the Connector class is called during READ mode connection, or when the openInputStream or the openDataInputStream method of the Connector class is called during WRITE mode connection.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

NO_RESOURCE

public static final int NO_RESOURCE
Means that no resource was secured (=2).
This is generated when resources required by the implementation in calling the open, the openInputStream, the openDataInputStream, the openOutputStream or the openDataOutputStream method of the Connector class cannot be secured.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RESOURCE_BUSY

public static final int RESOURCE_BUSY
Means that resource are in use (=3). This is generated when an attempt is made to open more connections simultaneously than the number guaranteed by the implementation by calling the Connector.open method in an http connection, resource connection and scratchpad connection and by calling the connect metod in an http connection.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

NO_USE

public static final int NO_USE
Means that the UE is out-of-range of the i-mode service (=4).
This is generated when the UE is out of the i-mode service area at the time the HttpConnection.connect method is called for an http connection.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

OUT_OF_SERVICE

public static final int OUT_OF_SERVICE
Means that the UE is out of the network service area (=5).
This is generated when the UE is out of the network service area at the time the HttpConnection.connect method is called for an http connection.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

IMODE_LOCKED

public static final int IMODE_LOCKED
Means that the i-mode related functions are locked (=6).
This is generated when the i-mode related functions in the UE are locked at the time the Connector.openconnect method is called for an http connection.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

TIMEOUT

public static final int TIMEOUT
Means that the process has been timed out (=7).
This is generated when the process has been timed out while the HttpConnection.connect method is being called for an http connection.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

USER_ABORT

public static final int USER_ABORT
Means that the process has been discontinued by the user (=8).
This is generated when the connection has been discontinued by the user while the HttpConnection.connect method is being called for an http connection.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SYSTEM_ABORT

public static final int SYSTEM_ABORT
Means that the system discontinued the process (=9).
This is generated when the connection has been discontinued by the system while the HttpConnection.connect method is being called for an http connection.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HTTP_ERROR

public static final int HTTP_ERROR
Means that the HTTP server returned an error (=10).
This is generated when a response code returned by the server while the HttpConnection.connect method is being called for an http connection is other than the 200s series (status codes meaning generally OK).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SCRATCHPAD_OVERSIZE

public static final int SCRATCHPAD_OVERSIZE
Means that the size of the scratchpad has been exceeded (=11).
This is generated when an attempt is made to write data larger than the scratchpad size in scratchpad connection.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SELF_MODE

public static final int SELF_MODE
Means that the UE is in self-mode (the mode which means the radio transmitting and the receiving functions are switched off) (=13).
This is generated when the UE is in self-mode at the time the Connector.openconnect method is called for an http connection.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SSL_ERROR

public static final int SSL_ERROR
Means that an error has occurred during SSL communication (=14).
This is generated when a certificate verification error (illegal expiration date, etc.) has occurred during https communication.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

ConnectionException

public ConnectionException()
Generates a communication exception object without a detailed message. The status is set to UNDEFINED.

ConnectionException

public ConnectionException(int status)
Generates a communication exception object without a detailed message.

Parameters:
status - Designates an integral value that indicates a cause of an exception.

ConnectionException

public ConnectionException(int status,
                           java.lang.String msg)
Generates a communication exception object with a detailed message.

Parameters:
status - Designates an integral value that indicates a cause of an exception.
msg - Designates a detailed message.
Method Detail

getStatus

public int getStatus()
Obtains the status value that indicates the cause of an exception.

Returns:
The integral value that indicates the status.
